intro: Schiedea apokremnos, commonly known as the Kona mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate of Hawaii. Schiedea apokremnos is an endemic species, meaning it is found nowhere else in the world. Due to its limited habitat and threats from invasive species, it is considered endangered.
